intro: Chiococca racemosa var. floridana, commonly known as the Florida chiococca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
